intro: Hedyotis parva, commonly known as the small dotweed, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are tiny, white or greenish, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Hedyotis parva is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for small insects.
